name: 5_Error_Example_ReactiveContext
content:
library(shiny)
Sys.setenv(LANG = "en")

## In this example we cause an error on purpose to illustrate common mistakes
## with shiny

## In detail we show:
## * that reactive elements must always be within an reactive context.


ui <- fluidPage(
  textInput(inputId = "MyText",
            label = "My text input: ")
)

server <- function(input, output, session) {
  
  ## We cause an error because "input$MyText" is not inside a reactive context
  ## (e.g. observe(), etc.)
  print(input$MyText)
  
  ## The following would work
  # observe({
  #   print(input$MyText)
  # })

}

shinyApp(ui, server)
#> Error: ... Can't access reactive value 'MyText' outside of reactive consumer.
